title: BAYLESS, Evelyn Nov 12, 1938 - Dec 25, 2023
text:
Evelyn Marie (Gilbert) Bayless, "Evie," passed away unexpectedly on Dec. 25, 2023, at the Champlain Valley Physicians Hospital surrounded by family. She was born on Nov. 12, 1938, to Maurice and Rachel Gilbert in Stony Point, N.Y.
Evelyn married the love of her life, William (Bill) Bayless, on Jan. 5, 1963. Together they raised a wonderful family and spent almost 61 years enjoying their Ford Mustangs, car shows, and visiting with friends and family.
She worked for 40 years at Elizabethtown Community Hospital, where she was known for her warmth and smile. Evelyn loved her job and made a lot of lifelong friends during her time at ECH. In her retirement, she loved spending time in the sun, driving around in her beloved purple Mustang, listening to country music, tidying her home, and shopping. Evelyn spread kindness and love wherever she went. She always let others know how much she loved them through lots of hugs, kisses and "I love you's." Evelyn loved spoiling her grandchildren and great-grandchildren. Her pets, Artie and Dixie, were an important part of her life.
She was predeceased by her children, Danny, William, Robin, and Alan; parents, Maurice and Rachel Gilbert; siblings, Gil, Bob, Dottie and Gloria; brother and sister-in-law, Maurice and Frances MacDougal; and a grandson, Alan Jr.
Left to cherish her memory are her husband Bill; son Wally (Milyn); grandchildren, Justin (Amanda), Kristen (Matt), Karin, and Heather; great-grandchildren, Abigail, Catherine, Kaila and Ajay; nieces, Christel and Angell; nephews, Craig, Eric and Darren, and many other nieces and nephews. She also leaves behind her dear friend Shelley Olsen.
A graveside service will be held in the spring at the Memorial Cemetery in Willsboro, N.Y.
Services were entrusted to Heidrick Funeral Home, 7521 Court St., Elizabethtown, N.Y. Online condolences may be left at
www.heidrickfuneralhome.com.

Plant a tree: How does it work
When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.
An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.
After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.
Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.
Tree Planting Timeline
Orders placed in:
January - May
Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.
June - December
Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
